title: KUWTK: Sofia admits she feels 'left out' around Scott's ex Kourtney during VERY awkward Finland trip
text:
Scott Disick's girlfriend Sofia Richie has admitted she felt 'left out' around his ex Kourtney Kardashian as they jetted to Finland for a family trip on Sunday's Keeping Up With The Kardashians.

The model, 21, left her boyfriend, 36 - who dated the mother of his three children, 40, from 2006 until 2015 - in an uncomfortable position when she confessed she was isolated as a blended family with their kids Mason, nine, Penelope, seven, and Reign, four.

Although things got off on the wrong foot, the Flip It Like Disick star later eased-up when he realised he could 'be alone with Sofia and not feel bad', with the group rounding off their trip with a viewing of the Northern Lights.

Candid: Scott Disick's girlfriend Sofia Richie has admitted she felt 'left out' around his ex Kourtney Kardashian as they jetted to Finland for a family trip on Sunday's KUWTK

At the beginning of the episode, TV personality Kourtney revealed she first wanted to go to the Northern European with her gal pals, but later decided to go with her children instead.

The mother-of-three shared: 'I was first going to go to Finland as a girls' trip, and then it just seems like a lot of the activities are things my kids would love.'

Doting dad Scott admitted he didn't want to 'miss out on anything when it includes the kids,' and eagerly agreed to join the group with his younger partner, who'd been on other trips with the family.

The model, 21, left her boyfriend, 36 - who dated the mother of his three children, 40, from 2006 until 2015 - in an uncomfortable position when she confessed she was isolated

Blended family: The couple joined Kourtney and Scott's children Mason, nine, Penelope, seven, and Reign, four, on the bonding trip

On arrival at Lapland's Arctic Treehouse Hotel, Kourtney, Scott and Sofia signed up for an icy activity in a bid to relieve the tension.

The blonde beauty noted that her man was only goofy when the pair were by themselves, but would act 'more sophisticated' when his former girlfriend was around.

Musician Lionel Richie's daughter Sofia saw that Scott was 'more sophisticated' with her when Kourtney was around, and he privately admitted to the cameras that he didn't really know how to act around his ex.

Admitting he 'didn't know how to act' around his ex, the reality star shared: 'It is definitely a really hard and awkward situation, and I just feel bad, because at the end, I want the people I love in my life to be happy.'

Tense: On arrival at Lapland's Arctic Treehouse Hotel, Kourtney, Scott and Sofia signed up for an icy activity in a bid to relieve the tension

He went on to reflect on the couple's 'great' relationship, but admitted the Chanel model felt lonely whenever they spent time with Kourtney.

Scott explained: 'The past six to eight months, we've been on a couple of trips where it's been Kourtney, Sofia, the kids and it's been great.

'But, Sofia mentioned to me that she feels a little left out, so I have to be careful not to overstep anyone's boundaries and make anyone feel left out.

'I don't want her to feel out of place, I don't want her to feel like she's not as comfortable as I am.

Behaviour changes: The blonde beauty noted that her man was only goofy when the pair were by themselves, but would act 'more sophisticated' when his former girlfriend was around

'I have to be careful not to overstep anyone's boundaries': Scott admitted the Chanel model felt lonely whenever they spent time with Kourtney

Awkward: During the family's visit to Santa's 'command center', the New Yorker attempted to tend to Sofia by leaving early, telling Kourtney that Mason was sick and had to take him home

'Sometimes you have so many inside jokes or inside things with somebody you've known for so long, even if you're not romantically with them, you don't really know how to act.

'It is definitely a really hard and awkward situation, and I just feel bad. At the end of the day, I want the people I love in my life to be happy.'

During the family's visit to Santa's 'command center', the New Yorker attempted to tend to Sofia by leaving early, telling Kourtney that Mason was sick and had to take him home.

Sharing her thoughts on his behaviour during their hot tub session, the brunette said: 'I just want everyone to have a great time and a great experience, and he's just kind of putting a dark cloud over it.'

Advice: Scott - who has been dating the celebrity offspring for over two years - went to desperate measures to ease the stress as he called Kim, 38

Scott - who has been dating the celebrity offspring for over two years - went to desperate measures to ease the stress as he called Kim, 38, to share how unhappy he'd been on the trip.

He acknowledged: 'I'm not even fun to be around for anybody.'

'[Sofia] seems like she's pretty cool with everything,' Kourtney's level-headed sister pointed out. 'If she's speaking up about something that bothers her, you kind of have to pay attention.'

She suggested that the entrepreneur should reference inside jokes when he was around Sofia to make her feel closer to him, which would in turn force Kourtney to understand their relationship.

When Scott talked to his ex, she urged him not to put so much pressure on himself, which helped him feel relaxed enough to embark on a snowmobiling trip with Sofia.

He shared: 'Sitting with Kourt and talking it through and communicating… it definitely made things a lot clearer.

'Now I know that people are having a good time, I realize that I can spend some time with Sofia alone and not feel bad.'

'At the end of the day, it was honestly just me and maybe some of my insecurities,' he concluded.

Keeping Up with the Kardashians airs Sundays at 9 pm EST on E!
